title: Joel M. Miller
text:
Joel M. Miller (born 1943) is an American politician from the state of <a href="New%20York%20%28state%29">New York</a>. He represented District 102 in the <a href="New%20York%20State%20Assembly">New York State Assembly</a>, which comprises <a href="Hyde%20Park%2C%20New%20York">Hyde Park</a>, <a href="Fishkill%20%28town%29%2C%20New%20York">Fishkill</a>, the <a href="town%20of%20Poughkeepsie">town of Poughkeepsie</a>, <a href="Clinton%2C%20Dutchess%20County%2C%20New%20York">Clinton</a>, <a href="Wappinger%2C%20New%20York">Wappinger</a> and <a href="La%20Grange%2C%20New%20York">La Grange</a> within <a href="Dutchess%20County%2C%20New%20York">Dutchess County, New York</a>. He is a <a href="Republican%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Republican</a>.
Miller served in the <a href="United%20States%20Air%20Force">United States Air Force</a> on active duty from 1967 to 1969, remaining in the <a href="Air%20Force%20Reserve">Air Force Reserve</a> as a <a href="Captain%20%28United%20States%29">captain</a> until approximately 1977. He is currently a <a href="major">major</a> in the <a href="New%20York%20State%20Guard">New York State Guard</a>.
After returning to New York in 1969, Miller established a dental practice in Poughkeepsie, which he maintained for the ensuing three decades. He served as a member of the executive committee of the Duchess County Dental Society for 26 years. He served as treasurer of the same organization for five years and was its president for two years. He was once the president of the Mid-Hudson Dental Management and Marketing Corporation and is still a member of its executive committee. He was re-elected in 2008, defeating Democrat Jonathan Smith.
Miller holds a B.S. from the <a href="City%20College%20of%20New%20York">City College of New York</a>, as well as a <a href="D.D.S.">D.D.S.</a> from <a href="Columbia%20University">Columbia University</a>'s School of Dental and Oral Surgery.
